unnormalised: I remember being absolutely clueless about when to prepone my travel plans back in 2022. See, my sister Priya's wedding was fixed around Diwali. She wanted a grand celebration in Jaipur, and naturally, everyone wanted to be there. The initial dates were a bit hazy, sometime around the 20th-25th of Oct '22, as the panditji was still calculating the most auspicious time. This created a bit of chaos with flight bookings, as prices fluctuated wildly.
normalised: I remember being absolutely clueless about when to prepone my travel plans back in two thousand and twenty two. See, my sister Priya's wedding was fixed around Diwali. She wanted a grand celebration in Jaipur, and naturally, everyone wanted to be there. The initial dates were a bit hazy, sometime around the twentieth to the twenty fifth of October two thousand and twenty two, as the panditji was still calculating the most auspicious time. This created a bit of chaos with flight bookings, as prices fluctuated wildly.

unnormalised: Then came the official announcement: Diwali on Oct 24th, 2022, and wedding festivities kicking off from the 22nd. Of course, tickets prices went through the roof! Trying to figure out the best time to arrive, balancing cost and convenience, was a real headache. Should I reach on the 21st night itself, just before the rituals begin? Or the 22nd morning and miss the initial ceremonies? I also had office work to wrap up before the long weekend.
normalised: Then came the official announcement: Diwali on October twenty fourth, two thousand and twenty two, and wedding festivities kicking off from the twenty second. Of course, tickets prices went through the roof! Trying to figure out the best time to arrive, balancing cost and convenience, was a real headache. Should I reach on the twenty first night itself, just before the rituals begin? Or the twenty second morning and miss the initial ceremonies? I also had office work to wrap up before the long weekend.

unnormalised: My cousin, Rakesh, suggested checking for travel deals closer to the actual date, arguing airlines often slash prices last minute to fill seats. His plan was risky but potentially rewarding. Another friend, Aisha, advocated for booking immediately, fearing even higher prices closer to the date. She showed me screenshots of flight rates spiking every hour. The stress was real. Finally, after many frantic calls and price comparisons, I managed to snag a decent deal for a flight arriving on 22/10/2022.
normalised: My cousin, Rakesh, suggested checking for travel deals closer to the actual date, arguing airlines often slash prices last minute to fill seats. His plan was risky but potentially rewarding. Another friend, Aisha, advocated for booking immediately, fearing even higher prices closer to the date. She showed me screenshots of flight rates spiking every hour. The stress was real. Finally, after many frantic calls and price comparisons, I managed to snag a decent deal for a flight arriving on twenty second October two thousand and twenty two.

unnormalised: Turns out, the wedding was spectacular, the food was amazing and the Diwali celebrations were memorable. Lesson learned: Indian festivals and weddings require strategic planning involving lots of number crunching and a bit of luck regarding dates and times! Next time, I'm prepone-ing my planning process at least 6 months in advance.
normalised: Turns out, the wedding was spectacular, the food was amazing and the Diwali celebrations were memorable. Lesson learned: Indian festivals and weddings require strategic planning involving lots of number crunching and a bit of luck regarding dates and times! Next time, I'm prepone-ing my planning process at least six months in advance.
